body_html:
I have a decorator that saves the parameters and results of decorated functions. This is useful to compare two versions. For example I have working versionA and decorate it so it saves baseline inputs and results (in eager mode). Then I use those inputs on versionB and compare the results. This allows me to simplify or make code faster but to test it still produces same results; or to port between keras/pytorch and compare the two versions. Why wouldn't args.pop(0) solve it? It is only executed for a bound function.
…

body:
I have a decorator that saves the parameters and results of decorated
functions. This is useful to compare two versions. For example I have
working versionA and decorate it so it saves baseline inputs and results
(in eager mode). Then I use those inputs on versionB and compare the
results. This allows me to simplify or make code faster but to test it
still produces same results; or to port between keras/pytorch and compare
the two versions.

Why wouldn't args.pop(0) solve it? It is only executed for a bound
function.

On Fri, 16 Nov 2018 at 01:44, Yan Facai (颜发才) <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> I'm afraid args.pop(0) cannot solve it, could you explain why to use
> decorator for __call__ method?
